topic.title: Integrate Retrofit Bypass Cabinet with Vertiv RPP

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\4x 120_ compare.pdf

C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\5x.pdf

body.p:
If you are installing a Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for a legacy Vertiv (Liebert) RPP, you must first prepare the RPP as summarized here:
Remove exterior and interior panels on the Bypass Cabinet side of the RPP.
Remove RPP Display and the Monitoring Logic Compartment. (Monitoring will be installed later in the Retrofit Bypass Cabinet.)
Disable or neutralize CTs in the RPP to prevent them generating a voltage
Disconnect and remove selected cam-loks-to-busbar cables on the RPP
Attach external label stating that the cam-loks are not energized.
Before working on Reactor Power Panel, make sure that power to the unit is disconnected and locked out.
Verify that power is not on to the RPP. Use a voltage meter to verify that voltage is not present.

li.p: Determine the side of the Vertiv RPP that will face the Retrofit Bypass Cabinet.
On that side, remove the exterior panel. There are (4) bolts to remove.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\6x.pdf

li.p: Remove the inside metal panel on the Bypass Cabinet side. Unbolt the panel from the inside.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\7.pdf

topic.title: Remove Vertiv RPP Display and Monitoring Compartment

li.p: Remove the Vertiv Display Panel and associated parts. The Display Panel must be detached from inside the unit.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\8.pdf

li.p: Inside the unit disconnect any cables attached to the Display and its associated PCB.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\9.pdf

li.p: From inside the unit unbolt the Display and PCB and remove the parts.
Remove the side panel on the Monitoring Logic Compartment. The compartment contains PCBs.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\10.pdf

li.p: Unplug the monitoring wiring that is connected to PCBs in this compartment.
Disconnect the cable for monitoring CTs from the monitoring board.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\11.pdf

li.p: Remove the connector on this cable.
Install a replacement connector (MOD67280) on the CT cable end. The replacement connector is shorted out to prevent the CTs from generating a voltage.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\12.pdf

li.p: Unscrew the retaining screws that hold the Vertiv Monitoring Logic Compartment in place. Retain screws for attaching cover plate.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\13.pdf

li.p: Completely remove the Monitoring Logic Compartment.

topic.title: Disconnect and Disable RPP Cam-Lok Cables

body.p:
Vertiv RPPs have cables from input power Cam-Loks to bus bars. Some of these cables must be disabled and stored in the RPP.
Inside the RPP, disconnect wires 4A, 47, 20, 21, 22, and 5 at both ends:
At the RPP load bus bars (shown at right)
At the RPP cam-loks
Remove the cables.

topic.title: Make Cut-Outs in the Cable Entry Panel

body.p: The Retrofit Bypass Cabinet has no knock-outs. Installers must make their own cable-entry cut outs. Cable entry is from the top of the unit.

topic.title: Attach Retrofit Bypass Cabinet to Vertiv (Liebert) RPP

body.p: Use the instructions on the following page to attach the Retrofit Bypass Cabinet to the Vertiv (Liebert) RPP.

You will do the following:
Place cover plates where you removed the Display and Monitoring Compartment
Join the two cabinets together
Add a label to the front of the Vertiv (Liebert) RPP stating that Cam-Loks are de-energized. Referenced parts are from

topic.title: Adjust Leveling Pads on Bypass Cabinet

body.p: Adjust Leveling Pads on the Bypass Cabinet to compensate for an uneven floor. Both sides of the Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv RPPs have leveling feet.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\17.pdf

body.p: Use an adjustable wrench to adjust leveling feet.Do not screw leveling pads completely out of their sockets.

topic.title: Anchor the Retrofit Bypass Cabinet to the Floor

body.p: Retrieve (1) Seismic Bracket with bolts that you retained when removing the Retrofit Bypass Cabinet from its shipping pallet. (Only one Bracket is needed. When the units are attached together, the RPP side is already secured to the floor.)
Attach the Seismic Bracket to the free side (outside bottom side) of the Retrofit Bypass Cabinet frame as shown below.
Secure the seismic bracket to two (2) floor anchors. The customer must provide floor anchors.
Now that the unit is secured to the floor, unscrew and remove (4) corner eye-bolts from the Retrofit Bypass Cabinet.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22038 P-164001120 Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Vertiv Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\21.pdf
